import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session

from fbprophet import Prophet

from neuralprophet import NeuralProphet

source.eb1e4a61:
def plot_close_val(data_frame, column, stock):
    plt.figure(figsize=(16,6))
    plt.title(column + ' Price History for ' + stock )
    plt.plot(data_frame[column])
    plt.xlabel('Date', fontsize=18)
    plt.ylabel(column + ' Price USD ($) for ' + stock, fontsize=18)
    plt.show()
source.f5815cab:
def fb_prophet_plot(df, param, stock, image_no):
    # Check the dataset
    #df.head()
    # Create Dataset based on the FB Prophet standard ds/y
    df2 = pd.DataFrame([], columns = ['ds', 'y'])
    df2.columns=['ds','y']
    df2['ds']=pd.to_datetime(df.index,format='%Y-%m')
    #Assign the Parameter
    df2['y']=df[param].values
    
    #create a new Prophet Model
    model=Prophet(interval_width=0.95,yearly_seasonality=True)
    model.add_seasonality(name='monthly', period=30.5, fourier_order=5)

    #Fit the Model
    model.fit(df2)
    #Predict the future for 50 periods
    future=model.make_future_dataframe(periods=50, freq='MS')
    forecast=model.predict(future)
    #Save the predicted model
    preds= forecast['yhat'][:-50]
    #plot the graph
    title = 'FB Prophet predictions for ==> ' + stock
    plt.figure(figsize=(16,8))
    plt.plot(df2.ds,preds,color='#555555',label=' Predictions')
    plt.plot(df2.ds,df2.y,color='#1155FF',label='Actual')
    plt.title(title)
    plt.legend()
    plt.show()
    figure=model.plot(forecast,xlabel='Date',ylabel='Price')
    a = add_changepoints_to_plot(figure.gca(), model, forecast)
    figure.set_size_inches(16,8)
    plt.title(title)
    model.plot_components(forecast)
    filename = '/kaggle/working/png/'+ str(image_no) + '_' + stock + '_fb_prophet_forecast.png'
    model.plot_components(forecast).savefig(filename)

    plt.show()
source.4bd17b3c:
def images_to_pdf_np(stock_list,output_file):
    pdf = FPDF('P','mm','A4') # create an A4-size pdf document 
    x,y,w,h = 5,5,200,250 #define margins
    # imagelist is the list with all image filenames
    filenamelist = []
    for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/working/png2'):
        for filename in filenames:
            print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))
            filenamelist.append(os.path.join(dirname, filename))
        #print(filenames)
    stock_ticker = ''
    for stock in stock_list:
        if any(stock in s for s in filename):
            stock_ticker = stock
        # whatever
    for filenames in filenamelist:
        print(filenames)
    # Begin with regular font
        pdf.set_font('Arial', '', 14)
        pdf.set_text_color(0, 0, 255)
        pdf.set_font('', 'U')
        pdf.add_page()
        pdf.write(5, filenames)
        pdf.add_page()
        pdf.write(5, stock_ticker)
        pdf.add_page()
        pdf.image(filenames,x,y,w,h)
    pdf.output(output_file, "F")
source.0fbe26ef:
def images_to_pdf(stock_list,output_file):
    pdf = FPDF('P','mm','A4') # create an A4-size pdf document 
    x,y,w,h = 5,5,200,250 #define margins
    # imagelist is the list with all image filenames
    filenamelist = []
    for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/working/png'):
        for filename in filenames:
            print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))
            filenamelist.append(os.path.join(dirname, filename))
        #print(filenames)
    stock_ticker = ''
    for stock in stock_list:
        if any(stock in s for s in filename):
            stock_ticker = stock
        # whatever
    for filenames in filenamelist:
        print(filenames)
    # Begin with regular font
        pdf.set_font('Arial', '', 14)
        pdf.set_text_color(0, 0, 255)
        pdf.set_font('', 'U')
        pdf.add_page()
        pdf.write(5, filenames)
        pdf.add_page()
        pdf.write(5, stock_ticker)
        pdf.add_page()
        pdf.image(filenames,x,y,w,h)
    pdf.output(output_file, "F")
source.c36ce7a9:
def neural_prophet_plot(df, param, stock, image_no):
    # Check the dataset
    #df.head()
    # Create Dataset based on the FB Prophet standard ds/y
    df2 = pd.DataFrame([], columns = ['ds', 'y'])
    df2.columns=['ds','y']
    df2['ds']=pd.to_datetime(df.index,format='%Y-%m')
    #Assign the Parameter
    df2['y']=df[param].values
    
    #create a new Neural Prophet Model
    model=NeuralProphet(n_changepoints=30,
                        changepoints_range=0.90,) 
    metrics = model.fit(df2, freq="D")
    metrics.head(3)
    #Build the future dataframe
    future = model.make_future_dataframe(df2, periods=365, n_historic_predictions=len(df2))
    future.tail(3)
    #Build the forecast
    forecast = model.predict(future)
    print(list(forecast.columns))
    # plots the model predictions
    fig1 = model.plot(forecast)
    
    # plots the individual forecast components for the given time period.
    fig = model.plot_components(forecast, residuals=True)
   
    # visualizes the model parameters.
    fig2 = model.plot_parameters()
 
    filename = '/kaggle/working/png2/'+ str(image_no) + '_' + stock + '_natural_prophet_forecast.png'
    model.plot_components(forecast).savefig(filename)

    plt.show()

    df = collect_data(stock,start_date) #Collect the data
    plot_close_val(df, 'Close', stock) # Plot the Closing Price
    i = i + 1
    fb_prophet_plot(df, 'Close', stock, i)
    neural_prophet_plot(df, 'Close', stock, i)

    i = i + 1
    fb_prophet_plot(df, 'Close', stock, i)
    neural_prophet_plot(df, 'Close', stock, i)

images_to_pdf(Symbols,"FB_Prophet_Forecast_Outputs_7.pdf")
images_to_pdf_np(Symbols,"Natural_Prophet_Forecast_Outputs_7.pdf")
print("All forecasting done!")

### Define a facebook plot. 
#### Do the following
* > _Create a dataset on FB Prophet standard with 'DS'and 'Y' value_
* > _Create a new Prophet Model with interval_width=0.95,yearly_seasonality=True_
* > _Fit the Model_
* > _Predict the future for 50 periods_
* > _Save the predicted Model_
* > _Plot the Model with the following types of plots_
* >> _Prediction Vs Actual Value for data Shared for 50 periods_
* >> _Future Forecast_
* >> _Seasonality Trends_
* >>> _Weekly_ 
* >>> _Yearly_
* >>> _Monthly_

source.c4f9b956:
# Use of Facebook and Neural Prophet for Stock Forecasting ## NSE-500 Stock forecast * This kernel uses Facebook Prophet (which uses SKLEARN) and Neural Prophet (which uses PyTorch) libaries to predict stocks. This kernel splits the NSE 500 stocks into ten folds and creates 10 output files each for the stocks in a PDF Format ### Yahoo! DataReader Download
Step-1: Download data using Yahoo! Finance Data Reader
### Facebook Prophet Models
Step-2: Build Facebook Prophet Input dataset
Step-3: Run Prophet Model
Step-4: Generate Model Visualization
Step-5: Generate the Image Files
Step-6: Consolidate Image Files for Facebook Prophet Model
### Neural Prophet Models
Step-7-11: Repeat Steps 2-6 for Neural Prophet Model
